----------------------------
The EXODUS | Did They Cross The RED SEA or SEA OF REEDS?

If we look at Ancient Hebrew manuscripts, there is no reference of a Red Sea crossing by the Israelites during the Exodus. Instead, the term used is Yam Suph, meaning Sea of Reeds. 

Tierney Peprah, author of Conspiracy to Erase a Nation, brings forth her views on this misinterpretation. On this interview on Something Nice with Dinano, you will learn something that might inspire you to search the Bible and dig deeper into Ancient Hebrew manuscripts and their meaning.
----------------------------
In the Hebrew Bible, "Yam Suph" refers to the body of water where the Israelites crossed during the Exodus, often translated as "Red Sea" or "Sea of Reeds," though the literal meaning is "sea of reeds".

title: From Job Loss to Street Food Success: Inspiring South African Story
description:
#SomethingNicewithDinano #SouthAfricanStreetFood #Business #BusinessIdea #OvercomingJobloss #Documentary #AfricanStories #YouthDay2023 

Channel Link: https://www.youtube.com/somethingnicewithdinano?sub_confirmation=1
---------------------------

QUESTION: WHAT TYPE OF BUSINESS CAN YOU START WITH R100 (U$5) IN YOUR COUNTRY?
---------------------------
In this inspiring documentary by Something Nice with Dinano, we talk to motivated street restaurant owner, Dominic "Dope Chicken" Zitha, a resilient street food entrepreneur from South Africa.

 After facing the effects of job loss, Dominic's drive and observance led him to embark on a journey, starting a street food chicken joint with just R100 ($5).
It has not been an easy journey but he says "Seeing my family happy" is what keeps me coming back to doing his business everyday.

He is now employing two of his siblings and looking to grow his business further. His is an inspiring story of a fighting spirit and determination to succeed.

The documentary captures his unwavering determination, resourcefulness, and unyielding passion for food entrepreneurship.
Dominic's venture,  dubbed "Dope Chicken," by his many loyal customers goes beyond just serving delicious street food-it embodies his personal story of resilience and the power of turning adversity into opportunity. 
With every crispy, flavorful bite, patrons not only indulge in mouthwatering chicken but also become part of Dominic's inspiring narrative.

Something Nice with Dinano follows Dominic as he transforms raw ingredients into culinary masterpieces, showcasing his unique flavors and culinary techniques. From marinating the chicken in his secret blend of spices to grilling it to perfection on a sizzling braai, Dominic's artistry is a testament to his dedication and culinary skills.

As the documentary unfolds, we learn about the challenges Dominic faced along the way. From navigating the complexities of permits and licenses to managing limited resources, his journey embodies the resilience required to transform a dream into a thriving business. 

His unwavering spirit and ability to adapt to changing circumstances become evident as we witness his growth and the loyal following he has garnered.

But this documentary is about more than just food and entrepreneurship; it is a celebration of the South African spirit. Dominic's story showcases the vibrant culture, community support, and entrepreneurial energy that define the nation's street food scene.

It serves as an inspiration to budding entrepreneurs, encouraging them to pursue their dreams, no matter the obstacles they face.

Discover how a simple dream, fueled by determination and a meager R100 investment, transformed into a thriving street food business that not only satisfies cravings but also inspires others to chase their dreams fearlessly.

Don't miss this incredible documentary, which serves as a reminder that even in the face of adversity, the power to rewrite our destiny lies within our own hands. 
Experience the flavors, the emotions, and the captivating story of Dominic "Dope Chicken" Zitha as he leaves an indelible mark on the South African street food landscape and beyond.
-------------------------
Thank you for watching, Please Like, Share and Subscribe.

title: Prison CHANGED My Life, Inside a South African Prison  | Miles Bhudu Story
description:
#PrisonLife #SouthAfricanPrison #Afrikaans #lifeinsouthafrica #PrisonStory #SouthAfricaToday  #MilesBhudu #somethingnicewithdinano 

Prison CHANGED My Life, Inside a South African Prison  | Miles Bhudu Story
----------------------------
On this episode of Something Nice with Dinano, ex-offender and prisoner rights activist, Miles Bhudu tells his story of how he lived Inside a South African Prison.
Born in a rural town on the East of Johannesburg in 1960, Miles Bhudu's rebellion pushed him towards a life of crime. 
Being the only to be convicted from a crime he committed with a number of acquaintances, this left him feeling bitter and betrayed. But a certain privilege of being able to speak Afrikaans in jail gave him favour amongst the prison warders guards.

Because of this advantage of speaking Afrikaans in jail, he was treated better than other prisoners and it opened a lot of opportunities for him Though he was privilege, he never ignored the oppression and ill treatment faced by his fellow inmates. 

Seeing how others were mistreated pushed him to start an organisation fighting for prisoner rights. 

This is Miles Bhudu's story.

title: Escape from SA Prison! Uncover Thabo Bester & Dr Nandipha | Miles Bhudu
description:
#ThaboBesterEscape #DrNandipha #G4S #MilesBhudu #ThaboBester #ThaboBesterArrest #Tanzania #SouthAfricaToday #somethingnicewithdinano 

Escape from SA Prison! Uncover Thabo Bester & Dr Nandipha | Miles Bhudu

Prisoner Rights activist and ex-convict, Golden Miles Bhudu says they informed prison stakeholders including the minister of Justice and Correctional Services, Ronald Lamola and other authorities about the Thabo Bester escape but they ignored us.

Bhudu says this escape is an embarrassment for South Africa and since his capture and arrest, local authorities will make sure they make Bester pay for this failure of the system. Bester has already raised concerns about his safety at Kgosi Mampuru Maximum Prison, suspecting that his food could be poisoned. 

The convicted rapist and murderer, Thabo Bester was re-arrested in Tanzania with his alleged accomplice and partner, Dr Nandipha Magudumana on their way to Kenya. The two have been on the run since an expose by a publication Ground Up, telling how Bester faked his death and escaped a G4S privately owned Mangaung Prison in March 2022?*

Bhudu says he also reached out to the two captured fugitives, advising them to hand themselves over to law enforcement authorities and negotiate for a plea bargain but his advice fell on deaf ears.

In this interview with Something Nice with Dinano he also reveals some of the behind the scenes dealings in South African prisons.

title: Poor White South Africans: Living in a Squatter Camp in South Africa Today
description:
#Poverty #southafrica #SomethingNicewithDinano #Afrikaner #WhiteSquatterCamp #AfrikanerAccent #southafricanaccent #FreeDocumentary #SouthAfricaToday #PoorWhiteSouthAfricans 

Poor White South Africans: Living in a Squatter Camp in South Africa Today | A documentary about white people living in poverty in Krugersdorp, South Africa.

South Africa is the most unequal country in the world. But it is rare for one to see white people living in poverty in this country which has the biggest European population in Africa. 

In Krugersdorp, west of Johannesburg there is a community of Afrikaner white people who are living in a squatter camp with black South Africans.

Among these people is an Afrikaner woman who is doing charity work in the community, her name is Elize Saunders.

She is running a soup kitchen to feed the community.

Saunders provides meals for the elderly and children in the community through a food donor and sponsor.

Having been moved there in 2015, they say they are living in peace with their black neighbours. In this documentary by Dinilohlanga Mekuto of Something Nice with Dinano, they speak about their way of living.

This is their story.

Disclaimer: A portion of the proceeds from the video will go towards helping Elize Saunders' charity efforts in Munsieville.

Isa asks an interesting question on the Bible's claim as the word of God. If God is perfect and the Bible is His book, written by men of God, inspired by His spirit, then how does one explain the differing accounts and inconsistencies in the Bible's account of Jesus' resurrection?

As a Christian, how do you answer this question?

I in turn ask him if Science always has answers, specifically asking about the Ceolacanth carbon dating issue.

title: Thomas Sankara QUOTES on the AFRICAN Revolution
description:
#ThomasSankara #WiseQuotes #Quotes #AfricanRevolution 

PLEASE SUBSCRIBE TO THE CHANNEL: https://www.youtube.com/somethingnicewithdinano?sub_confirmation=1 
============================== 
Thomas Sankara QUOTES on the African Revolution is a collection of quotes from Africa's greatest leader, Thomas Noel Isidore Sankara. 

A revolutionary, visionary, leader and artist. Sankara came into power in 1983, and changed the then French Colony from Upper Volta to Burkina Faso -" Land of the Upright People" in 1984. His term in office brought about meaningful change in what was then known as one of Africa's poorest countries. 

This video is made of a collection of his quotes from the Book, Thomas Sankara Speaks. Sankara's politics, governance and people skills continue to be a shinning light for many leaders to this day. Some of the changes he brought about in his country were unprecedented for the time. 

In the video he speaks on different topics including Imperialism, Feminism, Foreign Aid, the Revolution, the role of Soldiers and the people in a revolution and what needs to be done to take the African people and the continent forward. 

A strong feminist and advocate for self-sufficiency, Sankara stood by his word and was truly an upright leader who put the interests of the people and his country first. 
==============================

Economic Freedom Fighters Commander in Chief, Julius Malema says no African should be a foreigner in Africa. He says Africa should see itself as one country. With South Africa being part of Africa, Malema says all Africans belong in any part of Africa, "We Are ONE Country called AFRICA."

He says white people on the other hand are visitors in South Africa.

He says Africa is a country and Africans should view it as such. He goes on to say that the borders dividing the African continent into countries are colonial borders imposed on Africa by its colonizers. 

This Julius Malema testimony was given during his cross-examination at the Equality Court during his case on struggle song, Kill the boer (Kiss the Boer), in the Afriforum Hate Speech case brought on by Afrikaans lobby group, Afriforum. title: Joshua Maponga on Africa and the Bible, Christianity & Western Culture
description:
#MapongaJoshua #JoshuaMaponga #TheGospelAccordingToMaponga #DecolonizingChristianity #AmaBishop #BishopJoshuaMaponga #Africa #SouthAfrica

In this interview titled Joshua Maponga on Africa and the Bible, Christianity & Western Culture, philosopher, academic, theologian, social commentator and public speaker of note Joshua Marara Maponga III revisits some of his thoughts on how Africa and the Bible relate. 

This collection of soundbites from his last interview on Something Nice with Dinano, is a selection of a few clips where he focuses on how Africa and Africans relate to God of the Bible, what informs their spirituality and their connection with their ancestors. He brings forth certain claims on how Africans present themselves before God, saying Africans do not worship ancestors, but they do acknowledge them whenever they pray.

He continues to emphasize his assertion that Africa's relation with God precedes colonization and the advent of christianity, citing different African names for God as a way of showing that these people have been having communion with God.

The Gospel according to Maponga is about Africa and how Africa links with the history of the Bible and in his understanding, Africa plays a significant role in the Bible and prophecy, but because of how the gospel was presented to the continent by the Europeans, these African related truths have been neglected.

Bishop Joshua Maponga says Africans believe in a monotheistic God. Maponga is not only a theologian but is also a prominent commentator on news in South Africa and the African continent.

title: Stixo no Zinyo, Lubabalo Loyilani & Mpumelelo Matayi on their Xhosa Animation Series
description:
#Stixo #LubabaloLoyilani #MpumeleloMatayi #FunArtEntertainment #SouthAfricanPodcast #AnimationSeries #StixoCartoon #StixonoZinyo #SomethingNicewithDinano #Zinyo

Stixo no Zinyo, Lubabalo Loyilani & Mpumelelo Matayi created the Youtube animation sensation Stixo from characters they observed in their neighbourhood, Motherwell in Gqeberha, South Africa. They came up with the character, Stixo (Key) from fusing attributes from different players in their community as a way of educating women against the tactics of such players.

The duo started drawing at school and decided to take their talent further by promoting their talent on social media platforms to get an audience. Lubabalo and Mpumelelo then decided to start Stixo in 2018 to tell stories of players in their neighbourhood. They say their animation series doesn't only focus on the entertainment aspect of their product but they are also keenly interested in educating the youth on different issues affecting their communities.

In the next few months they are planning to focus more on growing their brand and are planning on getting into children focused animation productions.

They are both animators and voice-overs in the series, with Lubabalo voicing Zinyo and doing character animation and Mpumelelo on the other end is a background and scene animator and voices the main character, Stixo.

On this interview they also talk about Stixo Imfene episode, Stixo Taxi and Stixo no Zinyo, whilst they also explain the role Ace plays in the life of Stixo and Amanda and their relationship. The series talks and educates about social issues like teenage pregnancy and alcohol abuse.

They say they have a responsibility to educate and try to give an uplifting message in their comedy.

title: Dr David Molapo on Effective Leadership & Living a Life of Significance
description:
#Leadership #DavidMolapo #SomethingNicewithDinano #EffectiveLeadership #Motivational

Dr David Molapo is a change & leadership expert. His career spans over 20 years of mentoring, leadership and motivational speaking for change. He has served at top level at some of South Africa's biggest companies including SAA, Dimension Data and international entities like Billy Graham Foundation and UN South Africa.

In this interview on Something Nice with Dinano, Molapo talks about leading in a time of Unrest and Crisis. The world, Africa and South Africa are going through a global crisis brought upon by the COVID-19 pandemic. In Africa there is a need for vaccines but the continent is failing to provide facilities to manufacture them.

In South Africa there is civil Unrest and those in leadership seem to be reacting instead of being proactive to the situation at hand. Molapo offers advice to those in power by giving practical steps to problem solving and troubleshooting a situation of crisis,  so that one can rise to the occassion.

He says leaders are revealed during a time of crisis. Dr Molapo also reveals many factors hindering our leaders from being effective at the task at hand. 

Humility, self-awareness, empathy and having been coached, mentored and counselled as a leader can help in leading effectively. He makes sense, he is charismatic but most of all he is experienced in this field. 

He has also authored many books on the subject of leadership and change.

Listen, and learn from a person who has lead from the front and learnt from the best.

title: Joshua Maponga - Find Your Truth | African Theology
description:
#JoshuaMaponga #AfricanTheology #Christianity #AfricanReligion #AmaBishop #MojaLove #AfricanSpirituality #SomethingNicewithDinano

Accomplished teacher, bishop and artist Joshua Maponga has launched his latest book - Find Your Truth. In the book Maponga interrogates Africa's relationship with God, and looks at African Theology as a concept and basis for his spirituality.

On this episode of Something Nice with Dinano, Maponga says the book touches on issues concerning his journey and growth in matters of spirituality.  

His journey has taken him from growing up in a christian home, studying theology and discovering the impact of African Theology and Spirituality in Christianity. 

In the interview, He also clarifies how colonialists used religion to conquer Africa and its people. He mentions the African names of God, claiming God in African religion is a monotheistic God.

With over 30 years in christian ministry, Joshua Maponga has now decided to question what he has always known to be the truth and is on a journey to seek answers to his questions, in a quest to find his truth. 

This book will help you question and think deeply about what you have always known as your journey through life on your path to Find Your TRUTH.

Maponga has made a name for himself by presenting the gospel of Jesus Christ in a different and thought provoking way. He has also featured in various television programs including Abafundisi and AmaBishop on Moja Love.

title: African Democracy, #FeesMustFall & Activism - Masello Motana
description:
#MaselloMotana #SomethingNicewithDinano #Democracy #Activism #LandReform #KingLukaJantjie #LukaJantjie #Colonialism #MthokozisiNtumba #FeesMustFall #CyrilinaRamaposer #DigitalVibes

Artist Activist, Masello Motana talks about what is wrong with our governance systems. 

She also gives her opinion on the whether democracy is the best governance system for South Africa. On this interview she also explains the role of art and artists in political activism. Masello is of the firm belief that black people need to stop blaming white people for their hardships and start working towards unity and African governance systems.

Her latest work is a street performance where she re-enacts the killing of Mthokozisi Ntumba by police during the recent #FeesMustFall protests in South Africa. In the play, she explores and questions the power of the state, its role in providing education and the power of the police.

Masello is clear about what she wants to achieve with her art but maintains that she can only create work that stimulates our critical thought, but what we do with those thoughts is completely up to us as consumers, as citizens.


She also has a rap artist persona, Cyrilina Ramaposer, where she raps about topical issues in South African politics, check out her latest single Digital Vibes featuring The Crocodiles -  https://soundcloud.com/user-523630727/digital-vibes-by-cyrilina-ramaposer-the-crocodiles

title: Colonialism & Land Dispossession in South Africa - Masello Motana
description:
#SomethingNicewithDinano #LandReform #Colonialism #KingHintsa #Bambatha #EWC #SouthAfrica #LandDispossession

Performing Artist and Land Activist, Masello Motana has taken the fight for land in South Africa to new artistic levels. Her dramatic depictions of key historical moments in the dispossession of blacks from their land is profound and artistically captivating. 

In this interview with Something Nice with Dinano, Masello vividly paints the cruelty of colonialism in Africa and the history of land dispossession in South Africa, from an Artists perspective. Masello Motana is an actress,singer and street performer in South Africa who is not afraid to challenge the status quo through her art.

One of her recent works, The Three Beheaded Kings focuses on the murder of Kings, Hintsa, Bambatha and Luka Jantjie. She held a demonstration outside a public hearing where South Africa was embarking on land hearings on the proposed changes to Section 25 of the South African constitution. 

The proposed changes seek to give government the powers to expropriate land without compensation (EWC). 

Motana also did a dramatic interpretation of a "court case" where Luka Jantjie was tried for refusing to move from his ancestral land.

In this conversation, Motana also looks at some of the laws that cemented the fate of black people as they were forcefully removed from their spaces.

The conversation on land is important in Africa as the continent continues to deal with the effects of colonialism stemming from the removal of many native African people from their homes. 

Recently in Namibia, the German government has committed to pay reparations for the brutal genocide of the Herero and Nama people in the southern African country. South Africa and Namibia have a lot in common on the issue of land dispossession as the two were previously ruled by the notorious apartheid regime of South Africa.

title: Joshua Maponga on His Message for Africa & where He Stands with the Bible | PT 2
description:
#SomethingNicewithDinano #JoshuaMaponga #AmaBishop #DecolonizingChristianity

Joshua Maponga is at a cross roads, after 33 years in christian ministry, he has found himself in a place where he can't find satisfying answers to his questions. His questions stem from a life o dedication to his calling but some things remain a history.

He says God gave us brains to think and questions are a sign of a functioning brain. On this interview he tries to explain where he stands with the Bible.

Maponga feels strongly about Africa and says in his understanding, Africa plays a significant role in the Bible and prophecy, but because of how the gospel was presented by the Europeans, these African related truths are neglected.

He is calling on Africa to embrace its humanity and the knowledge available to emancipate itself from spiritual poverty it is facing.

Maponga, who also features on AmaBishop, a Moja Love production, says he is writing a book titled, The Gospel according to Maponga J and will be one African children will be reading and referring to in years to come. His message is decolonizing christianity.

title: Owen Ndlovu, From Rural KZN to Soccerzone, influencing Youth Culture at YFM & SABC Struggles | PT 1
description:
#SomethingNicewithDinano #OwenNdlovu #SoccerZone #SportAt10 #SABC #YFM #Maskandi #SoulBrothers

In this two part interview, Owen Ndlovu says he is not a broadcaster but an entertainer. He says his background has pushed him to become a better person. A street smart hustler, business man and sports entertainer . 

Ndlovu was born in Soweto but moved to Newcastle in 1976 during the Soweto Uprising when he was only 4. 
He says growing up poor was motivation enough to make success of himself. He attributes Cyril Bongani "Kansas City" Mchunu and Koos Radebe as his early influences for wanting to get into radio a dream he soon realized after coming back to Johannesburg when he obtained his matrix certificate. 

His broadcasting journey started at Soweto Commumity Radio to YFM and later UKhozi FM and SABC 1, Soccerzone. 

In this interview with Something Nice with Dinano, Ndlovu talks about influencing youth culture at YFM and money lessons learnt along the way. He also talks about almost becoming a musician with Dan Tshanda and Dalom Kids after he was influenced by Zulu maskandi group Soul Brothers.

title: Leaving Christianity for ukuthwasa, becoming ixhwele-isangoma: Sinovuyo Mbonda | PT 2
description:
#SomethingNicewithDinano #SinovuyoMbonda #ixhwele #iSangoma #LeavingChristianity #AfricanTradition

Sinovuyo Khandiyeza Mbonda talks about Leaving Christianity after he could not find answers to many of his questions. 

He says "Maybe it was because I read a lot, as some Christian brothers would caution against such..." He says he doesn't have any regrets because his spiritual journey has always been about knowledge and truth. Now he is iXhwele (African Herbalist) and on his way to be isangoma/igqirha and consults with abaphantsi, izinyanya, amadlozi. 

In part 2 of my interview with him, he tells of his scepticism when he got into African spirituality and how his consultaion with amagqirha helped him to believe in abaphantsi.

He also answers some questions from people who have an interest in his life story.

title: From Born Again Christian to African Traditional Healer (iXhwele-Sangoma): Sinovuyo Mbonda | PT 1
description:
#AfricanTradition #SomethingNicewithDinano #Ixhwele #igqirha #Sangoma #Adventist #AdventistChurch #SinovuyoMbonda #LeavingChristianity

Sinovuyo Mbonda's journey started with a genuine quest to find answers to his questions. When he accepted Christ in his early teens, he wouldn't have believed you if you said one day, he would be ixhwele or igqirha (sangoma). Infact he would have dismissed that thought without flinching. But as he grew in his knowledge of Christ, he continued to have many unanswered questions. 

The questions led to more reading and knowledge seeking until he reached a point where christianity didn't resonate with him. He left the Adventist church, but saw himself coming back as it was the only thing he knew. Unfortunately his soul was not at peace as he realised that, going to church didn't come naturally anymore, it felt forced until he decided, this christianity "is not for me."
From there he had dreams and started learning about African origins and spirituality, he later answered his calling to become iXhwele - Sangoma.

He tells his story in such an engaging manner. This is part 1 of a two episode interview. In part 2 he talks about his African Tradition beliefs and what it means to him.

The interview is about him leaving Christianity for spirituality.

20 year-old Lithemba "TheBigDeal" Dyantyi is someone worth knowing. He is the founder of Cape Town based comedy skit content creators who have built a name for themselves as Xhosanostra Skits. Originally from eDutywa, in the Eastern Cape, Lithemba Dyantyi moved to Kayamandi, Stellenbosch to join his mother in 2006.

He later opened a YouTube channel where he posted skits by himself, but soon realized that his content was not popular. He says "In the early stages I could only get like 15 views...I was disappointed but never discouraged." 


After my lonely efforts I decided to collaborate with my friends on my street, and we would do content that reflects on the lives and stories we experience on a daily basis.

That slow start soon turned to success after he roped in his friends and created classic comedy skits like Ezam Kum, Bad buddies and Bra Dan the Barber.

Lithemba and his crew call themselves - Internet Gangsters and are leading the pack in comedy skit content creation and number one in Xhosa skits creation.

title: Solomon Ashoms on confronting Bushiri,exposing Jay Israel fallout with Uebert Angel & Alph Lukau
description:
#SomethingNicewithDinano #ShepherdBushiri #SolomonsTemple #SolomonAshoms #UebertAngel #AlphLukau #JayIsrael #AmaBishop

In part 2, Solomon Izang Ashoms, an investigative journalist who has been exposing the powers behind prophets and bishops in the Christian church tells of how  fake prophets and pastors are recruited.

He calls out, what he calls charlatans; so-called prophets who are out to make themselves rich through staged prophecies and miracles. Solomon, who also runs a youtube channel: Solomon’s Temple, says confronting Bushiri on his fake miracle – walking on air left the controversial self-proclaimed prophet giving explanations that did not make sense.

With years, investigating and exposing these fake prophets, he has managed to figure out how they work. For example, Ashoms says Alph Lukau is a master of staging miracles to such an extent that he hires people to memorise scripts and act these made up stories at church as genuine miracles. He says these people also use the pulpit to intimidate people who question their authenticity. 

On this episode, he also exposes the truth behind Jay Israel’s fallout with U.K. based Zimbabwean, Uebert Angel.

Solomon Izang Ashoms is also part of the Mojave Love television series, AmaBishop.

title: Solomon Ashoms on Shepherd Bushiri & Bishop Zondo as false prophets according to the Bible | PT 1
description:
#SomethingNicewithDinano #ShepherdBushiri #BishopZondo #SolomonsTemple #SolomonAshoms #Bushiri #AmaBishop

In part one of a two part interview, Solomon Izang Ashoms, an investigative journalist who has been exposing the powers behind prophets and bishops in the christian church tells of the workings of Prophet Shepherd Bushiri and Bishop Stephen Zondo. Solomon's work spans over many years on the topic of powerful church leaders. 

He has not had an easy way in doing this research, as he has received a number of death threats from the so-called prophets and their associates.

Ashoms has been producing documentaries on church figures like TB Joshua, Shepherd Bushiri, Stephen Zondo and Alph Lukau to name a few.

Having done interviews with people involved in these "cult" churches, as he refers to them, he says many of them have spiritual powers, but such powers were not gifted to them by God of the Bible.

He references the Bible to support his claims, together with many interviews from victims who were abused by these "false prophets".

In this interview he focuses on two controversial characters, Prophet Shepherd Bushiri and Bishop Steven Zondo.

ECG leader, Prophet Bushiri aka Major 1 is being trialed in South Africa for money laundering together with his wife Mary, where they recently escaped to Malawi, violating their bail conditions in the process.

Whilst Bhishop Zondo of Rivers of Living Waters ministries is being investigated by the CRL Commission for questionable practices at his church, claims rising from testimonies include claims of witchcraft at the church.

Solomon Izang Ashoms is also part of television series AmaBishop on Mojave Love.

title: South African farmer Manyano Rasmeni on sustenance farming in South Africa
description:
#FarmingInSouthAfrica  #SouthAfricanFarmer #ExpropriationWithoutCompensation  #SomethingNicewithDinano #LandDebate #HowToFarm #LandReform #UrbanFarming #BlackFarmer

Manyano Rasmeni is a black South African farmer from the Eastern Cape. Rasmeni is an organic farmer who left his corporate job in Marketing to follow his passion for the land. 

He enjoys working with his hands and says one doesn't need a big piece of land to be able to farm successfully. 
He is currently farming on a hectare sized piece of land, where he is growing about 50 different crops together with poultry farming. 

Rasmeni gives advice on farming in South Africa for sustainability. His skills and advice can help those seeking to get land and use effectively during South Africa's land reform program. 

The country is looking at an amendment of its constitution to allow for expropriation of land without compensation as a means of giving back land to black South Africans who were dispossed during colonial and apartheid years.
